Florida: ^What are you even supposed to do? A giant infectious storm, really?
^You should probably leave, for starters. Yeah, that sounds like a good plan.
^You could find some stuff to bring in your car, too. You don't have much time, by the sound of it - maybe a few hours?
^Food is important, but so is water. Fuel, too. You're pretty sure your landlord has some spare gas hidden somewhere in case the power ever goes out.
^Gas will probably be hard to come by. -1 hour

c-0: ^You scramble around your apartment, grabbing as many containers you can to fill with water.
^You probably have enough time to grab something else... but what?
^Gas will probably be hard to come by. -1 hour
c-1: ^You dig through every cupboard in your apartment, fishing for as much food as you can find.
^You probably have enough time to grab something else... but what?
^Gas will probably be hard to come by. -1 hour
c-2: ^You sneak downstairs, finding the door to the storage room already open. Most of the supplies have already been cleared out, but you find a full jerrycan left.
^You probably have enough time to grab something else... but what?

Missouri: ^It's hard to believe the news is real... a giant, infectious storm? That sounds like the plot to some horrible movie.

g-0: ^You look around, gathering your bearings and trying to decide the best course of action. You weren't able to grab much from home...
^When's the last time I got gas?
g-1: ^Maybe you could collect supplies from around here? It's not like anyone is around to use it anymore.
^Yeah, that's a good idea. But what to look for first? There's only so many hours in the day...
g-4: ^You walk forward more, noticing a lone mechanic waiting outside what appears to be an abandoned garage.
^"What are you still doing here? They sent out the evacuation notice hours ago."
^"The same could be said about you, y'know."
g-5: ^"Fair enough. What's the problem, anyway? You don't seem to rushed to get out of here."
^"I just find this all hard to believe. A mutant storm full of spores?"
^"I was on my way out now, just had to get my some things in order before I leave my life behind."

c-9: ^"I wouldn't be too sure about that. I've seen some of the people they've been wheeling across the street, and it looks pretty bad."
^"Rashes and blisters all over their face, some of them throwing up everywhere too."
c-10: ^"I get it. I've heard it's pretty bad though - seen people around with blisters and rashes all over. Looks... painful."

g-6: ^"God, that's awful. Maybe the news was right for once. But, if you saw it all, why aren't you leaving?"

c-11: ^"Can't, the government shut down the buses. I got left here to tough it out."
^"It wouldn't feel right leaving you stranded, can I offer a ride?"
^"Probably a good idea... I better head out early while I can. Good luck out there."

c-0: ^"Are you sure? I wouldn't want to be a burden. I've handled a lot in my life, some mushrooms shouldn't be too hard to deal with."
^"No, please, I insist. No decent human could leave someone else here stranded."
^"Then I accept. My name's Jane, by the way - figured you might want to know before you let me in your car."
^"Pleasure to meet you Jane. It looks like we've got a long road ahead of us."

c-1: ^"Yeah, I get it. No sense in both of us waiting around for something we can't stop."
^"I'll keep that in mind. Stay safe."

c-0: ^"You too, kid. Drive safe out there."
^As you turn around to head back to the car, you think to yourself. Maybe this is bigger than you thought?

Illinois: ^Never thought I would actually step foot in Illinois but here we are, there's always a first for everything.
^Excuse me mister, do you know where I could find the closest gas station?
^Hrmph, I've seen plenty of punks like you coming by here causing all sorts of trouble. *cough cough* Be on your way now.
^Please sir, I'm just looking for some supplies to help on my drive. I've come from Florida and I'm only about half way to the bunker.
^Bunker?!? Don't tell me you beleive in all this alien shit. *cough cough* I've seen plenty of these so called viruses come and go. They haven't gotten me yet so why should I leave?
^Based off the things I've witnessed myself, I wouldn't be too sure of that. This virus is messing people up bad.
^Listen I don't blame you, I don't know how much of this I believe either but they're closing down the state lines. Everyone's gotta leave.

c-0: ^Nothing a little *cough cough* medicine can't fix.
c-1: ^Not me, I'm staying right here with the r- *cough*.. excuse me.. the rest of my farm
g-0: ^I hear ya man, but anyway, do you know of any gas stations around here?
^Not any open within at least an hour , I'll tell ya what though, since I beleive we see eye to eye about most.
^How about you follow me up the way to my cabin I'll let ya leave with a few things.
^Thats awfully generous, but I should really get going. Can't get caught in any more traffic.

c-2: ^I know that feeling, well feel free to look around the street here. People leave things around all the time.
^Thank you sir. Are you sure you don't want to hitch a ride to the bunker, I've got more room in the back.
^ Stay Safe out there, I hope the storm doesn't cause too much hard to your farm.

c-0: ^So the roads really are that bad? I guess it can't be that bad of an idea.*cough cough* I guess I'll hitch a ride, thanks man.
^Search the nearby road for left over supplies. -4 Hours

g-1: ^That would be incredibly helpful. Anything you could offer is great. -4 hours

c-3: ^I figured my supplies aren't doing anyone justince just sitting around here doing nothing.

c-2: ^As much as a pain you young folk are, I wish you the best of luck out there.
^I wouldn't wanna be out on those roads, but more importantly I cant leave my crops out here alone.

OutOfTime: ^You freeze in place, realizing suddenly that the spores in the air are multiplying at a frightening rate. You've stayed here too long.
